description_txt: stated on March 3, 2017 in various public comments.:
quote_txt: On whether or not the Philadelphia DA's office will recommend the possibility of parole for all juvenile lifers.

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2017 in an interview on Meet the Press:
quote_txt: Blue Cross Blue Shield ended "2016 open enrollment with 1 million members in the Florida marketplace."

description_txt: stated on March 15, 2017 in a Florida House subcommittee hearing:
quote_txt: "Unlawful presence (in the United States) is not a crime."

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2017 in a news conference in the Capitol:
quote_txt: "A woman working full-time is paid 79 to 80 cents for every dollar a man is paid, and it's even less for women of color, and on average $11,000 per year is lost simply because she isn't a man."

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2017 in a Florida Senate committee hearing:
quote_txt: "Currently, half a million Floridians have Alzheimer’s disease, and in less than 10 years, a 40 percent growth rate means that another 200,000 Floridians will develop this devastating illness."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2017 in a press conference:
quote_txt: The House Republican health care "plan doesn't get rid of Medicaid expansion."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2017 in his first Cabinet meeting:
quote_txt: "In the first full month of my administration following the issuance of my executive orders, illegal immigration on our southern border fell by an unprecedented 40 percent."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2017 in a news release:
quote_txt: A report from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office "confirms that the American Health Care Act will lower premiums."

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2017 in In front of a crowd in Northwestern PA:
quote_txt: He’s only there for one purpose and one purpose only, and that is to run a shadow government that is gonna totally upset the new agenda.

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2017 in a speech at CPAC:
quote_txt: "According to the FBI, Mexican drug cartels are working with 100,000 street gang members in Chicago alone."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2017 in a listening session on health care:
quote_txt: "One-third of the counties — think of it, one-third — only have one insurer left" on the Affordable Care Act exchanges.

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2017 in an interview on MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: Says President Donald Trump's travel ban could ban Somalis "from getting relief (from famine) through coming to the United States."

description_txt: stated on February 28, 2017 in in a Internet rumor:
quote_txt: "Babysitter on crystal meth eats 3-month-old baby."

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2017 in posts on the Internet:
quote_txt: "FBI issues Warrant For Obama’s Arrest After Confirming Illegal Trump Tower Wiretap."

description_txt: stated on February 21, 2017 in a Philly.com article:
quote_txt: ShopRite will lose about 300 employees "voluntarily and through layoffs" due to the beverage tax.

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "‘TrumpCare’ would allow insurance execs to personally make millions off your health care."

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2017 in an interview on "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "The number of individuals who actually got coverage through the exchange who didn't have coverage before, or who weren't eligible for Medicaid before is relatively small. So we've turned things upside down completely for 3 million, or 4 million, or 5 million individuals."

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2017 in a segment on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "If the CBO was right about Obamacare to begin with, there'd be 8 million more people on Obamacare today than there actually are. … Sometimes we ask them to do stuff that they're not capable of doing."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2017 in a statement at a legislative breakfast:
quote_txt: "And this would be the first year, if everything holds true, we will spend over $10 billion of our state budget on Medicaid out of the $28 billion budget."

description_txt: stated on February 27, 2017 in a Facebook Live interview with Austin bureau reporters for the Dallas Morning News:
quote_txt: Says condoms "used to be tax-exempt here in Texas."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2017 in a press briefing:
quote_txt: The Obama administration said "they were going to be able to drive folks away from one of the most expensive areas for the provision of health care, and that is the emergency rooms. In fact, they did just the opposite."

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2017 in an interview on CNBC:
quote_txt: Carbon dioxide is not "a primary contributor to the global warming that we see."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt:
"Cost of iPhone: $399
- Cost of healthcare for 1 year: $10,345
- Hearing @jasoninthehouse compare the 2 as if they are the same: priceless"

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2017 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "Wisconsin’s graduation rates have grown to over 90 percent" since Tony Evers became state school superintendent.

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2017 in the annual budget speech:
quote_txt: Says he presented "a balanced budget."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2017 in an interview on MSNBC's "All In With Chis Hayes":
quote_txt: The GOP health care plan gives "$275 billion in tax breaks for the top 2 percent, people earning $250,000 a year or more."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2017 in an online post:
quote_txt: On filibusters for U.S. Supreme Court nominees.

description_txt: stated on March 5, 2017 in Internet posts:
quote_txt: A photo shows "Obama being dragged before a judge in handcuffs for wiretapping Trump."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2017 in a oress conference:
quote_txt: Under the Affordable Care Act, "some people were gaming the system" by paying "for nine months of insurance, get 12 -- the other three for free."

description_txt: stated on March 7, 2017 in his State of the State speech:
quote_txt: "Florida is now the only state in the nation to tax commercial leases."
